channel.title: ASM Updater
channel.description: It's more of a proof of concept, and has very few hooks, but I like it. Somewhat based off the last updater I posted, I've taken out the annotation stuff, just because it's slow and sucks. Also, dependency handling has been improved.

item.title: ASM Updater
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

I don’t see why the topic is named “ASM Updater”. Anyone with a mind and a minimal knowledge of bytecode can understand quite clearly what a properly named bytecode library is doing, or so I’d hope.

Read full topic

item.title: ASM Updater
item.dc:creator: @unlimitedorb unlimitedorb
item.description:
@unlimitedorb wrote:

White Castle:

Uhh, couldn’t you do that with any bytecode library? I thought that’s why their purpose was.

Some libraries have unique aspects that can be better suited for certain tasks than others. ASM has the ability to be faster than BCEL if used correctly, but it’s a bit less flexible in some situations. It just depends on what you want to do and how you want to achieve it. Using the ASM object API rather than the core event API certainly provides you with an advantage as far as ease of use, but the nature of how class information is stored can be a real performance hit as all of is stored in memory right off the bat. Just because he provided a sample of a certain use of ASM doesn’t mean that that’s all the library is capable of doing. If anything, you should look at it as a showcase to see the syntactical differences between other bytecode libraries because you might find that it’s easier to use and a better way to do what you are already doing.

Read full topic

item.title: ASM Updater
item.dc:creator: @joey0101 joey0101
item.description:
@joey0101 wrote:

[quote=“Fasga, post:12, topic:193487”][quote author=joey0101 link=topic=257519.msg2141032#msg2141032 date=1206722544]
I have made one of these myself. Its strange because ASM is suposidly faster but for this kind of stuff its actually quite slow.
[/quote]

If you use the visitor pattern properly, it is extremely fast. However, imo, the tree package is much better suited for this kind of work.[/quote]
Yes I used the tree package mostly also because that way you can crack open methods properly and examine thier contents using AbstractInsnNodes and stuff.

Read full topic

I have made one of these myself. Its strange because ASM is suposidly faster but for this kind of stuff its actually quite slow.

item.title: ASM Updater

item.description:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:5, topic:193487”]Because he made it sound like it is very new, but it uses a version from a year ago.

I guess if the hooks still work, then that is good. It just seems strange.[/quote]
#460 update of runescape.jar occured 06-26-07_13 md5sum: 2c1da40fc1fbf0e143ac6053bf59c8f8
Not quite…It’s current enough to still be perfectly functional.
